file_content.text: I just heard from another village. The sensors helped them repel a whole Sand People raiding party.
I just received a delegation from one of the outer settlements that said the sensors had already helped them repel an anooba attack.
They want to discuss a formal alliance with the Republic.
I cannot thank you enough.
Tatooine is a dangerous place to call home.
I'm glad they're safe.
Just put the word out there.
Believe me, Coruscant will be hearing your name.
I've always found credits more effective than words.
Try money.
The transfer is already made, my friend. You don't even have to ask.
You know, when I first came here, I admit I was hoping not to stay. I mean, the weather alone....
But the people here, they've got something you just don't see on Coruscant. I'm glad we'll have them on our side.
Once those sensors are in place, this might even be a nice place to visit.
Well, good day to you!
I can't imagine what would bring one hero of the Republic all the way out here, much less the whole group of you.
I didn't think I'd see an honest-to-life Jedi here for another decade.
It's an honor to meet another servant of the Republic all the way out here.
If I'm not mistaken, you have the look of the Core Worlds about you. A generation or two on Tatooine, there's just something that shows.
I am Tre Nareves, goodwill ambassador to Tatooine for the Galactic Republic. Dare I hope you're here in the Republic's service as well?
Does the Republic need my aid for something?
Of course.
I'm usually pretty friendly to its cause. You need a hand?
I wouldn't say that, but....
I believe we might, yes.
That's the kind of friendly greeting that always comes before asking me to risk my life.
You want something.
I... cannot even imagine what you've been through that you would jump to such conclusions. But you aren't wrong.
I hate small talk.
I am here to gain grassroots support for the Republic by offering our technology to defend Tatooine's settlements.
But there've been... complications.
That sounds ominous.
Complications?
I really was trying to help.
Tell me what you need.
You want to give these guys ships and weapons?
What kind of technology?
Oh, no! Nothing like that. Believe me, the Senate remembers that Toydaria debacle.
I have perimeter sensors that detect specific life-forms. They'll help the settlers protect themselves from wraids, Sand People, that sort of thing.
Unfortunately, in trying to set the sensors, several locals were killed. By wraids, Sand People, that sort of thing.
And now, um, they're blaming me for the deaths unless I set the sensors myself.
It is a worthy cause to defend these people, whether they are our formal allies or not.
I can set the sensors.
A good point, Master Jedi. My apologies for seeming so self-interested.
I've done my share of perimeter runs. X-87 models?
You need me to set them?
Yes. Yes, I believe they are.
I've disabled--um--"worked on" a variety of perimeter sensors in the past.
I might be able to help.
Oh. That's very... encouraging.
Is this a favor or a job?
I have a discretionary spending account for... um, discretionary spending. I can see you're well-compensated.
The locals all agreed that the best place for the sensors was in some of the taller rock embankments. They should last longer that way.
Here's everything I've got. If you get these working, we might show them the Republic's got their best interests at heart.
Defense and diplomacy aren't really my strong suits. Sorry.
Not my thing. [Refuse quest]
Oh. Well, um, if you change your mind, I don't think anyone else is going to risk setting them any time soon.
The Republic supports Tatooine's continued independence.
